name: It's Halloween! Any spooky build ideas?
author: Dagger

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Horror and fun - trick or treat - undead and dead?

You get the picture. 
Do you have any build ideas that would fit the theme, or that would blend in with the celebration?

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Hmm - you present an interesting challenge, Mr Dagger, with many possible avenues to go down (all dark, foggy and unlit, of course).

- First, there's your classic vampire, which I'm guessing should be a shape-shifting charmer, so maybe a Druid/ Shifter/ Bard?
- Next, there's the hulking, seemingly unstoppable brute. Perhaps an EDR Half-Orc or Dwarf of some type?
- Then you have the stealthy, slashing sociopath: Assassin definitely (maybe with some SD thrown in).
- The diabolic is next up - maybe a Sorcerer/ BG/ RDD (don't even know if that's possible)? *
- Mustn't forget the dear old undead, so PM can finally make an appearance (I've been trying to avoid it until now: a shame Cleric isn't a 'feed' into the class, really).
- Werewolf pretty much has to be a Druid, and I want to say Barbarian.
- Almost forgot the more playful sprite type - Rogue of some sort (maybe hin?).
- There really should be a Cleric in the mix somewhere: after all, it is All Saints' Eve, so has (un)holiness all over it.
- I could go on, but won't.

Just a few ideas to encourage folk!

EDIT: * Oops - of course it's possible - Moghedian. I am an idiot. I know that's a Bard rather than a Sorcerer, but it does make it better, I think. That said, there's nothing wrong with going for Sorcerer - if you flip Paladin to BG and do some juggling with levels, your own Spellsword of Bahamut appeals, Mick.
